Think Bernie and AOC types) and the Bloc QuÃ©bÃ©cois (A party thatâ€™s only really active in Quebec and advocates specifically for Quebec).  In this election not only did the Liberals gain seats but they picked up 169 seats which is just shy of the 172 needed for a majority. This time theyâ€™ll be able to caucus with just the NDP which is further left of the Liberals.  Not only that but Carney is the only major party leader who actually kept his seat.   All in all itâ€™s been a fantastic election for the Liberals who were projected to lose in a blowout only a few months ago, and itâ€™s disingenuous to suggest otherwise.
